items.title: Noindex-options
items.description: Option to hide a page from Google is added to frontpages also. Available in page-settings for both articles and frontpages: Settings -> Article Settings/Front Settings -> SEO-settings -> Hide from Google

items.title: Social media icons for articles
items.description: Social media icons can now be toggled on an article level. Go inside Settings -> Article Settings -> Article styling to disable or enable icons.

items.title: Responsive sizes default enabled for mobile
items.description: Images, padding and text-sizes is now responsive for mobile. Use the feature flag `Disable responsive mobile fonts` to disable this feature for a site.

items.title: Latest Articles auto-refresh
items.description: The Latest Articles list will now automatically refresh every minute.

items.title: Labrador AI - Text-suggestions
items.description: Labrador can now help you write title, subtitle, SEO-title, SEO-description, SoMe-title, SoMe-description and tags for an article. It can also generate title and text with a summary of the article for a factbox. Labrador AI is available in the text-tool for title and subtitle in articles through the menu `Insert/Suggestion`. It is also available in article-settings for tags and in the tab `SEO-settings`. In the Labrador-menu there's a button ( ) to open a modal where you can generate all texts in one go. If you check the option 'Auto-insert' Labrador will automatically generate and insert suggestions for you when you have written enough bodytext.

items.title: Faster byline-search
items.description: When searching for bylines minimum 3 characters is required. This will speed up the search.

items.title: Change order of menu-items in menu-admin
items.description: You can now use drag and drop to reorder menu-items created in the admin-pages.

items.title: Responsive sizes on mobile
items.description: You can now activate responsive sizes for text and images on mobile. Activate the feature by adding the feature-flag `Responsive mobile fonts` for your site.

items.title: Added hotkey to reset styling of rich text
items.description: Whereever you edit rich text you can now reach the reset-button ( ) using the hotkey `Ctrl+Escape` / `Cmd+Escape`.

items.title: Define image-height in ArticleScroller
items.description: You can now specify the aspect ratio for images in the article-scroller. Available in the settings-panel ( ).

items.title: Add background-images to rows
items.description: In the row menu: Click the more settings button ( ) and select 'Background image' to enable a dropzone for images. You can then drag and drop any image to the row. To edit the image-crop click the more settings button ( ) and select 'Edit background'. Click the image to edit it as usual. If you want to add a transparent background color on top of the image to make text more readable, click the color options button ( ), select a color and a opacity.

items.title: Ad-preview in bodytext
items.description: Ads that are programmatically inserted into the bodytext of an article will now be visible in the editor. A placeholder is displayed at the same position as the ad will display on a published page on front.

items.title: New slideshow-options
items.description: Slideshows may now display dot navigation and previews of all images below the slideshow. Options available in the slideshow dropdown-button ( ). Options can be set per viewport, so you may display dot-navigation on desktop only if you wish.

items.title: Added element Top Comments
items.description: This element will display lists of your latest and most popular articles. End user may select one of the lists. To include on a page: Hit `C` to open the elements-collection, search for `top comments`, drag and drop it where you want to.

items.title: Tansa proofreading available
items.description: You can now proofread the bodytext of articles using Tansa. Activate in the admin-pages by inserting your license-key.

items.title: Updated zoomable images in bodytext
items.description: The zoomable option now present the enlarged image with a new design that ensures that the image fit properly on screen. Click the magnify-button ( ) in a viewport in the editor to allow users to click on the image to view it in full screen mode.
